replies:
White supremacists, like many extremists, get radicalized online. There is a well-documented digital rabbithole that young men fall into: they often go in frustrated young people & come out w/a formed hateful ideology.

That‚Äôs the way radicalization works. https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/24/opinion/sunday/facebook-twitter-terrorism-extremism.html¬†‚Ä¶

If we truly want to address the problem of white supremacist violence, we have to learn how to recognize it + how it shows up in our culture.

Surprisingly to some, signs of white supremacist culture are NOT easy to spot early for those aren‚Äôt aware.

Because it‚Äôs everywhere.

At first, learning about white supremacy can be confusing or challenging.

There‚Äôs a lot there, + it can be emotionally hard to realize one may have done or participated in something racist in the past (& still may slip up!).

That‚Äôs okay. The whole point is learning + improving.
Wow we are already making this political. Of course we cannot let a good crisis go to waste can we ?

Okay, so, here's the thing.

This IS political.

Part of the purpose of a society is to find ways to avoid massive horrifyingly violent incidents where people end up dead.

What you're objecting to is "political" people TRYING TO FIND A WAY TO STOP THIS FROM HAPPENING.

As a member of a couple of marginalized groups, almost everything that happens to my community is considered "a political issue." 

I've been told I'm "too into politics" since I was a teenager because I was talking about things that affect me and others like me.

And when people look at a tragedy and say "Don't politicize this," they are ignoring the fact that political solutions are a way of trying to stop tragedies from happening.

We live in a society. Politics is how we get things done in a society.

If you had your way, every tragedy would be met with quiet, reverent thoughts and prayers, and then forgotten, because to even discuss changing the systems that threaten my safety is always going to be fundamentally rooted in political discourse.

So. We must "politicize" this.

You might not know this, but most crime is intra-racial.
